data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about Four Way Multi-Location Control Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, …]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the Four Way Multi-Location Control Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The Four Way Multi-Location Control Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of Four Way Multi-Location Control Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#One Failed Immediately – I’m Pulling Them All Out. I’m a licensed electrical contractor and typically use Pass & Seymour Legrand switches. I bought this ELEGRP 10-pack because of the price and high reviews, but I won’t make that mistake again. Right out of the box, the switches felt rough, clunky, and low quality ,definitely not what I’d call contractor-grade. I needed them for a job the next day, so I reluctantly installed six. One failed immediately and wouldn’t function at all. Because of that failure and how poor these feel, I’m planning to remove all of them and replace them with reliable switches. I can’t take the risk of callbacks or failures on a job. I’ve used ELEGRP outlets before without issue, but after this experience, I’m not sure I’ll trust anything from them going forward. Not worth the risk.
1#Not a good product. Second cLass item. Election said that they were not real good. Had to have him come out. Ed
2#Excellent. Just as indicated. Well manufactured and easy installation.
3#Well made but difficult to install for a beginner. I would say I am an intermediate skilled DIYer and I found these light switches to be a bit more difficult to handle. The wires must be bent perfectly around the screw to be secured properly so it took a little time since my house is older and the wires are more robust. I was still able to complete the project and all switches worked properly. Would buy again for sure just took some practice on bending the wires properly.
4#Beautiful. Used all through our new home. Purchased everything from the same company. Look great.
5#Great Value. Happy with the quality and love that the seller had all the other pieces we need for our DIY home renovation project.
6#Does not fit #12AWG copper wire with out a LOT of work!! Made to fit #14AWG copper wire but it one works real hard #12AWG copper wire will work. BUT it should not take that much work since the description says it fits #12AWG copper wire. I would not buy again.
7#4 way or 3 way electrical switch. Has back screw wire insert, but you need to make sure and pull on wire to make sure clamp tight. Or jut J hook em. Good so far.
8#Good price. Switches worked out wonderfully and can’t beat the price. I recommend them.
9#Nice price but incredibly frustrating to install. As others have commented - attaching wires to these switches is very frustrating - the screws recede into the housing when trying to use the external screws to wire to, and trying to insert the wires into the back 1) is very difficult and 2) requires you to "tighten the screw" which just seems to spin without tightening to retain the wire. The switches are cheap but if you value your time and all get a reputable brand so you don't feel the need to smash these cheap switches with a sledgehammer when you can't get the wires to stay put.
10#Save Money. OK... if you plan to wire more than one 4 way switch, get this. It will pay for itself if you only use two of them.
11#Easy to install. I replaced old toggle switches with these rocker switches because they look more modern and upscale. They were easy to install and look good. They work well.
12#Good Value. Over all good product for function and cost. Only complaint is the rocker takes a little effort to push on or off. There is more resistance when pushing on the rocker, it's not as light and smooth action like a Bestten. Also it took a little more than usual effort to wire the nut because it's short. The push in option also took a little effort for it to get in the hole.
13#Little did I know. Little did I know that you only need one four-way switch and two three-way switches to make a three switch circuit work properly. So I ended up with a lot of extra four-way switches. I wish that in the product description it would state something like that prominently. I guess it’s time for eBay lol.
14#Unusable (Poorly engineered). Every other switch that I've installed connects wires using one of two ways: Either the wire slides into a hole "quick-connect", or you screw the wire to the side screw. This switch, however, you install by inserting the wire into a hole on the back, and then tightening the screw, which pulls a square nut that's inside of the housing to secure the wire. The problem is that 14AWG or larger doesn't fit into the holes with the large square nuts inside. (The nut obstructs the hole.) Also, you can't secure the wire to the outside because the screw is secured to the square washer inside alone rather than the housing itself, so it won't remain straight enough to hold the wire. I'm not sure why they designed them this way, perhaps the quick connect and side screws are patented or something. Buy these if you have small gauge wire, or enjoy being frustrated.
15#Working well. Good color and function
16#Cheap but solid residential. They're cheap, but solid. Of couse, can't beat Leviton and Lutron brands. Leviton and Lutron are expensive, therefore, it's a better option. For decorator wallplates, don't buy them from ELEGRP. Go with "ENERLITES Screwless Decorator'. Trust me, they will make your life easier, furthermore, ENERLITES have so many colors to choose from. BUT ENERLITES receptacle isn't that good. Therefore, buy receptacle from ELEGRP, but for wallplates, go for ENERLITES. ELEGRP wallplates are very difficult to open. Most of the times, you end up breaking them.
17#Rápido. Buen artículo
18#Switch switch. They work like they should, easy to install in my electrically stupid home. Idk who install the electrical in my home but I home he quit his profession because it’s wired funny…but even with that issue, these worked great!
19#almost perfect. 4-way switch is the most convenient switch of all. It can be used as single pole, 3 way, or 4 way switch. The only down side of this particular brand is that it makes a loud soud when switch. Otherwise, it would be a 5 star product.
